    <link>https://zenodo.org/search</link>     </textInput>          <item>   <title>rdf-uml-diagram: First Release</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16013</link>   <description>Graphical representation of RDF set similar to UML diagrams</description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Markus Graube</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 20:11:32 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16013</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>           <item>   <title>spectral-cube: Small bugfixes and feature additions</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16012</link>   <description>Library for reading and analyzing astrophysical spectral data cubes</description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Thomas Robitaille</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 20:09:25 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16012</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>           <item>   <title>python-colormath 2.0.0</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16011</link>   <description>Backwards Incompatible changes   Minimum Python version is now 2.7. ColorBase.convert_to() is no more. Use colormath.color_conversions.convert_color() instead. API isn't as spiffy looking, but it's a lot less magical now. Completely re-worked RGB handling. Each RGB space now has its own class, inheriting from BaseRGBColor. Consequently, RGBColor is no more. In most cases, you can substitute RGBColor with sRGBColor during your upgrade. RGB channels are now [0..1] instead of [1..255]. Can use BaseRGBColor.get_upscaled_value_tuple() to get the upscaled values. BaseRGBColor.set_from_rgb_hex() was replaced with a BaseRGBColor.new_from_rgb_hex(), which returns a properly formed sRGBColor object. BaseRGBColor no longer accepts observer or illuminant kwargs. HSL no longer accepts observer, illuminant or rgb_type kwargs. HSV no longer accepts observer, illuminant or rgb_type kwargs. CMY no longer accepts observer, illuminant or rgb_type kwargs. CMYK no longer accepts observer, illuminant or rgb_type kwargs. Removed 'debug' kwargs in favor of Python's logging. Completely re-worked exception list. Eliminated some redundant exceptions, re-named basically everything else.    Features   Python 3.3 support added. Added tox.ini with supported environments. Removed the old custom test runner in favor of nose. Replacing simplified RGB-&gt;XYZ conversions with Bruce Lindbloom's. A round of PEP8 work. Added a BaseColorConversionTest test class with some greatly improved color comparison. Much more useful in tracking down breakages. Eliminated non-matrix delta E computations in favor of the matrix equivalents. No need to maintain duplicate code, and the matrix stuff is faster for bulk operations.    Bug Fixes   Corrected delta_e CMC example error. Should now run correctly. color_diff_matrix.delta_e_cie2000 had an edge case where certain angles would result in an incorrect delta E. Un-hardcoded XYZColor.apply_adaptation()'s adaptation and observer angles. </description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Michael Mauderer</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 19:02:57 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16011</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>           <item>   <title>python-colormath 2.0.1</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16010</link>   <description>Features   Lots of documentation improvements.  convert_color() now has an explicitly defined/documented target_illuminant kwarg, instead of letting this fall through to its **kwargs. This should make IDE auto-complete better and provide more clarity. Added clamped_rgb_r, clamped_rgb_g, and clamped_rgb_b to RGB color spaces. Use these if you have to have in-gamut, potentially compressed coordinates.    Bug Fixes   Direct conversions to non-sRGB colorspaces returned sRGBColor objects. Reported by Cezary Wagner. </description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Michael Mauderer</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 19:02:34 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16010</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>           <item>   <title>python-colormath 2.0.2</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16009</link>   <description>Bug Fixes   Apparently I didn't add the function body for the clamped RGB properties. Yikes. </description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Michael Mauderer</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 19:02:03 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16009</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>           <item>   <title>python-colormath 2.1.0</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16008</link>   <description>Features   Added new NetworkX graph-based resolution of conversions between color spaces. Reduces boilerplate and makes it much easier to add additional color spaces going forward. (MichaelMauderer) Added the IPT color space. (MichaelMauderer) Added Color Appearance Models. Natayani95, Hunt, RLAB, ATD95,  LLAB, CIECAM02, CIECAM02-m1. (MichaelMauderer)    Bug Fixes   xyY conversions now correctly avoid division by zero. (dwbullok) Un-transposed adaptation matrices. Has no effect on conversions,  but if you use these directly you may see different numbers. (JasonTam) During XYZ-&gt;RGB, linear channel values are now clamped in order to avoid domain errors. Output should now always be between 0 and 1. </description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Michael Mauderer</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 19:01:28 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16008</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>           <item>   <title>python-colormath 2.1.1</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16007</link>   <description>Bug Fixes   Add network to install_requires. (Ed-von-Schleck) </description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Michael Mauderer</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 19:01:10 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16007</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>           <item>   <title>Meta-analysis of gene expression using the elastic net</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16006</link>   <description>Software and instructions&nbsp;for performing a meta-analysis of gene expression, as well as all data necessary to reproduce the meta-analyses of gene expression in&nbsp;lung cancer samples.</description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Hughey, Jacob</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 16:38:57 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16006</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>           <item>   <title>Schroedinger_SOLVER</title>   <link>http://zenodo.org/record/16005</link>   <description>Schroedinger_SOLVER is an IGOR PRO procedure that integrates numerically the Schroedinger equation with the NUMEROV method [1]&nbsp;to obtain the time-independent or stationary solutions, for any given 1-D potential. The solver assumes boundary conditions in which the wave function is zero at both extremes of the space domain (coordinate x). In practice this means that the potential is assumed to be infinite at xmin and xmax. Therefore, for the moment the code is not prepared for solving, for example, the Coulomb potential.  Igor version 6.3 or later is needed, and it has been tested in MacOS (Snow Leopard) and Windows (XP).  A quick explanation of how it works can be seen in youtube:&nbsp;http://youtu.be/natEp4Oy9sU  References:  [1]&nbsp;Numerov, B.&nbsp;Note on the numerical integration of&nbsp;\\(d^2x/dt^2=f(x,t)\\) Astronomische Nachrichten, Wiley Online Library, 1927, 230, 359-364  &nbsp;</description>   <dc:creator xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">Jes\ufffd\ufffds Mart\ufffd\ufffdnez-Blanco</dc:creator>   <pubDate>Thu, 12 Mar 2015 15:28:09 GMT</pubDate>   <guid>http://zenodo.org/record/16005</guid>   <dcterms:issued xmlns:dcterms="http://purl.org/dc/terms/">2015-03-12</dcterms:issued> </item>         </channel> </rss>
